title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #641: Edge-Disjoint Cycles on Same Vertex Set**

Is there a function f such that χ(G) ≥ f(k) implies G has k edge-disjoint cycles on the same vertices?

**Answer**: NO (DISPROVED by Janzer-Steiner-Sudakov 2024)

Fails even for k = 2: graphs exist with high χ but no 4-regular subgraph.

title: Graph
content:
**Graph V** = SimpleGraph V

A simple undirected graph on vertex set V.

title: Proper Coloring
content:
**IsProperColoring(G, k, c)**: A function c: V → Fin k such that adjacent vertices have different colors.

∀ u v, G.Adj u v → c u ≠ c v

title: Chromatic Number
content:
**chromaticNumber(G)** = min { k | G is k-colorable }

The minimum number of colors needed for a proper coloring.

title: Cycle
content:
**IsCycle(G, vs)**: A closed path with no repeated vertices.

- Length ≥ 3
- All vertices distinct
- Consecutive adjacency
- Last vertex adjacent to first

title: Edge-Disjoint Cycles
content:
**EdgeDisjointCycles(G, c1, c2)**: Two cycles sharing no edges.

Both are cycles, and no edge appears in both cycles simultaneously.

title: k Edge-Disjoint Cycles Same Vertices
content:
**HasKEdgeDisjointCyclesSameVertices(G, k, S)**:

k cycles, all on vertex set S, pairwise edge-disjoint.

This is the structure the conjecture asks about.

title: Regular Graph
content:
**IsRegular(G, r)**: Every vertex has degree exactly r.

∀ v, degree(v) = r

title: Regular Subgraph
content:
**HasRegularSubgraph(G, r, S)**: G contains an r-regular subgraph on vertices S.

A subgraph H where every vertex in S has degree r in H.

title: Cycles ↔ Regular
content:
**edge_disjoint_cycles_iff_regular**:

k edge-disjoint cycles on same vertices ↔ 2k-regular subgraph.

This equivalence is why the problem reduces to finding regular subgraphs.

title: Erdős-Hajnal Conjecture
content:
**ErdosHajnalConjecture** (DISPROVED):

∃ f : ℕ → ℕ such that χ(G) ≥ f(k) ⟹ G has k edge-disjoint cycles on same vertices.

Janzer-Steiner-Sudakov showed this is FALSE.

title: Conjecture (Regular Form)
content:
**ErdosHajnalConjectureRegular**: Equivalent formulation.

∃ f such that χ(G) ≥ f(k) ⟹ G has 2k-regular subgraph.

Using the cycle-regular equivalence.

title: The k = 2 Case
content:
**Case_k_2**: Does high χ imply a 4-regular subgraph?

This is the specific case that JSS disproved. Even this weakest case fails!

title: k = 2 is FALSE
content:
**case_k_2_false**: ¬Case_k_2

The k = 2 case is false, which implies the full conjecture is false.

title: JSS Counterexample
content:
**jss_counterexample**: The Janzer-Steiner-Sudakov construction.

For all n ≥ 10, there exist graphs with:
- χ ≥ c · (log log n)/(log log log n)
- No 4-regular subgraph

This disproves the conjecture.

title: JSS Chromatic Bound
content:
**jss_chromatic_bound(n)** = ⌊(log log n)/(log log log n)⌋

The chromatic number achieved by the counterexample graphs.

title: No 4-Regular Subgraph
content:
**jss_no_4_regular**: For n ≥ 10, the JSS graphs have:

∀ S, ¬HasRegularSubgraph G 4 S

No subset of vertices induces a 4-regular subgraph.

title: Main Disproof
content:
**erdos_hajnal_false**: ¬ErdosHajnalConjecture

The Erdős-Hajnal conjecture is FALSE.

Proof: JSS gives graphs with arbitrarily high χ but no 4-regular subgraph.

title: Erdős #641 DISPROVED
content:
**erdos_641**: ¬ErdosHajnalConjecture

Erdős Problem #641 is DISPROVED.

title: High χ → Long Odd Cycles
content:
**high_chi_long_odd_cycle**: A positive result.

High chromatic number DOES force long odd cycles. This is true even though regular subgraphs are not forced.

title: Gyárfás Theorem
content:
**gyarfas_theorem**: Another positive result.

High χ implies either large clique number or long odd cycle.

Contrast: Regular subgraphs are NOT guaranteed.

title: Kim Bound
content:
**kim_bound**: Triangle-free graphs have χ = O(√(n/log n)).

Shows that triangle-free graphs can have high chromatic number, relevant to understanding the counterexample.

title: Hadwiger's Conjecture
content:
**HadwigerConjecture**: χ(G) ≥ t ⟹ G has K_t minor.

A famous OPEN conjecture about chromatic number forcing minors.

title: Final Result
content:
**erdos_641_disproved**: ¬ErdosHajnalConjecture

**Summary**: High chromatic number does NOT guarantee k edge-disjoint cycles on the same vertex set, even for k = 2.

Janzer-Steiner-Sudakov (2024) constructed the counterexample.
